author: John Doe
body: Hi, I just received invoice #INV-2026-0142 and the amount is $47.50 higher than my subscription plan. I'm on the Team plan at $299/mo but was charged $346.50. Can you look into this?

author: jamie.wilson
body: Hi! I've pulled up your account and I can see the discrepancy. It looks like a prorated charge was applied when you added 2 seats mid-cycle on Feb 10. Let me verify the exact breakdown.

author: John Doe
body: That makes sense for the seats, but I only added 1 seat, not 2. Can you check the seat change history?

author: jamie.wilson
body: You're absolutely right — I can see only 1 seat was added on Feb 10 but the system logged it as 2. I've filed a correction and a credit of $47.50 will appear on your next invoice. I'm sorry about this.

author: Jane Smith
body: I've tried resetting my password 5 times today and the email never arrives. I've checked spam, verified my email address, and tried both Chrome and Firefox. I'm locked out of my account.

author: sarah.chen
body: I'm sorry you're experiencing this. Let me check the email delivery logs for your account. Can you confirm the email address on file?

author: Jane Smith
body: It's jdoe@acmecorp.com. I've been using this account for 2 years without issues.

author: sarah.chen
body: I found the issue — your domain acmecorp.com recently updated their DMARC policy and our transactional emails are being rejected at the server level before they reach your inbox. I've triggered a reset via our backup delivery system. You should receive it within 5 minutes.

author: Jane Smith
body: Got it! Thanks for the quick fix. Might want to flag this for other acmecorp users too.

author: Alice Johnson
body: Our team works late shifts and the bright white dashboard is painful at 2am. Any plans for dark mode?

author: mike.rodriguez
body: Thanks for the feedback! Dark mode is on our roadmap. I've added your vote to the feature request. Currently 47 other customers have requested this as well.

author: Alice Johnson
body: Great, any ETA? Even a simple CSS invert would be better than nothing.

author: Bob Williams
body: For the past 3 days, our main dashboard takes 30-45 seconds to load. We have 50 agents and this is killing our response times. Happens in all browsers.

author: jamie.wilson
body: I'm escalating this to our engineering team immediately. Can you share your organization ID so we can check the backend metrics?

author: Bob Williams
body: Org ID is ORG-8842. It started around Tuesday afternoon.

author: jamie.wilson
body: Found it — there was a database index that got corrupted during our Tuesday maintenance window. The team is rebuilding it now. You should see improvement within the hour.

author: Bob Williams
body: Confirmed — loads in under 2 seconds now. Thanks for the fast turnaround.

author: Carol Brown
body: We moved offices. New billing address: 500 Market St, Suite 300, San Francisco, CA 94105. Please update.

author: jamie.wilson
body: Updated! The new address will appear on your next invoice. Let me know if you need anything else.

author: David Lee
body: After updating our Okta integration to use the new OIDC connector, none of our 200 agents can log in. This is a P1 for us.

author: alex.kumar
body: This is critical — I'm looping in our integrations team right now. Can you share your Okta tenant URL and the error message you're seeing?

author: David Lee
body: Tenant: acme.okta.com. Error: 'invalid_client — The client_id is not valid.' We triple-checked the client ID.

author: alex.kumar
body: Our integrations engineer found it — the new OIDC connector requires the client ID to be URL-encoded when it contains special characters. Your client ID has a '+' character. We're pushing a hotfix that handles this automatically. ETA 30 minutes.

author: David Lee
body: Hotfix is live. Can you try logging in again?

author: alex.kumar
body: Working! All 200 agents are back online. Please add URL-encoding to your setup docs.

author: Eva Martinez
body: We just signed up for the Enterprise plan and want to set up webhooks to push ticket events to our Slack channel. Where do I configure this?

author: sarah.chen
body: Welcome aboard! Webhooks are configured under Settings → Integrations → Webhooks. Here's a step-by-step guide: [link to KB article #42]. You'll need your Slack webhook URL which you can generate at api.slack.com/incoming-webhooks.

author: Eva Martinez
body: Perfect, got it working. One more question — can we filter webhooks to only fire on high-priority tickets?

author: sarah.chen
body: Yes! In the webhook configuration, there's a 'Conditions' section where you can set priority >= high. You can also filter by assignee group, tags, or custom fields.

author: Frank Garcia
body: We're hitting the 200 req/min rate limit constantly with our CRM sync. We process 10,000 tickets/day and the current limit means syncs take 50 minutes instead of 5.

author: mike.rodriguez
body: I understand this is impacting your workflow. For Enterprise customers, we can increase the rate limit. Let me check what tier would work for your volume.

author: Frank Garcia
body: We'd need at least 2000 req/min to keep syncs under 10 minutes.

author: mike.rodriguez
body: I've approved a rate limit increase to 2500 req/min for your API key. The change is effective immediately. I've also set up monitoring on our side to make sure this doesn't impact service quality.

author: Grace Kim
body: We need a full export of all ticket data from the past 12 months for our SOC 2 audit. What format options do you have?

author: alex.kumar
body: We support JSON, CSV, and JSONL exports. For audit purposes, I'd recommend JSONL as it preserves all metadata including internal notes and timestamp precision. You can run: cliaas zendesk export --subdomain yourco --out ./audit-export

author: Grace Kim
body: Does the export include ticket deletion history and access logs?

author: alex.kumar
body: Yes, the full export includes audit trails. Access logs are in a separate endpoint — I'll add that to the export manifest. Give me a moment to prepare the extended export.

author: Henry Patel
body: We keep having incidents where two agents reply to the same ticket within seconds of each other, sending contradictory answers to customers. Is there a locking mechanism?

author: sarah.chen
body: This is a known pain point. We have a 'ticket locking' feature in beta — when an agent opens a ticket, others see a banner saying 'Sarah is viewing this ticket' and replies are queued rather than sent immediately. Want me to enable the beta for your account?

author: Henry Patel
body: Yes please! How does the queue work exactly?

author: sarah.chen
body: When Agent B tries to reply while Agent A has the lock, their reply goes into a 'pending review' state. Agent A sees a notification that a conflicting reply exists and can merge, replace, or discard it. I've enabled the beta for your org.

author: Iris Nakamura
body: We're migrating from our old system and have 5000 tickets in CSV format. What's the best way to import them while preserving timestamps and assignee history?

author: jamie.wilson
body: For bulk imports, use our CLI tool: cliaas import --format csv --input ./historical.csv --preserve-timestamps. The CSV needs columns: subject, description, status, priority, created_at, assignee_email. I can send you a template.

author: Iris Nakamura
body: That would be great. Will it also import the reply threads?

author: jamie.wilson
body: Reply threads need to be in a separate CSV with ticket_id, body, author_email, created_at columns. Run the ticket import first, then the replies import. The CLI handles the linking automatically.

author: Jack Thompson
body: We'd like to downgrade from Enterprise ($999/mo) to Team ($299/mo) at the end of this billing cycle. We no longer need SSO or the advanced reporting.

author: mike.rodriguez
body: I can schedule that downgrade for you. Just to confirm: you'll lose access to SSO, advanced reporting, custom roles, and the API rate limit will drop from 2500 to 200 req/min. The change takes effect on March 1.

author: Jack Thompson
body: That's fine. We've already migrated off SSO. Please proceed.

author: mike.rodriguez
body: Done — your plan will switch to Team on March 1. You'll receive a confirmation email shortly. If you change your mind before then, just let us know.

body: Got it! Thanks for the quick fix. Might want to flag this for other acmecorp users too.

author: alex.kumar

body: Great, any ETA? Even a simple CSS invert would be better than nothing.

body: Confirmed — loads in under 2 seconds now. Thanks for the fast turnaround.

body: Updated! The new address will appear on your next invoice. Let me know if you need anything else.
